cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 mi south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move north-northwest through the eastern Gulf, make landfall on the Florida Panhandle, then accelerate northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas before emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast and racing out into the North Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / Big Bend (near Panama City–Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to the central Gulf Coast (AL/FL border west to MS/AL border, plus Tampa Bay).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from the Alabama/Florida border eastward to the Suwannee River, FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle) first, then interior Southeast and eventually the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to gale force possible Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge possible in Chesapeake Bay but significant (>3 ft) inundation not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain, locally up to 6 inches, Thursday into early Friday could trigger localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado risk in outer rain bands Thursday; reduced visibilities and standing water may disrupt terminal and landside operations.
